reviews.text: I recently stayed overnight at the Dunhill. The service was excellent. My room and bathroom were very clean. The atmosphere is quite charming.The rooms are on the small side, but you cannot beat the location for staying in the city center of Charlotte. Breakfast at the Harvest Moon restaurant is delicious! The hotel is downtown, so there is some street noise, but not more than one would expect in an city location. I would recommend the Dunhill to any out of town guests who might visit.
reviews.title: Great location and comfortable stay in Uptown

reviews.text: On frequent weekly visits to Charlotte, I stayed at the Dunhill which is at a convenient location to my place of work. It is a historic hotel with beautiful albeit small rooms. Clean bathrooms, free soda and cookies. Extremely courteous staff. The bed is really soft and may not be ideal for those who prefer otherwise.
reviews.title: Vintage, pleasant, charming and clean

reviews.text: I liked it a lot for its central location in "uptown" Charlotte, and also it's vintage and historical presence.
reviews.title: Charming, downtown & clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were in CLT for an extended date night and decided to stay at the dunhill since it's historic. They have a cute little bar, attached restaurant for breakfast and nice staff.
reviews.title: Badly needs some updating

reviews.text: We walked to the dandelion market and other after dinner bars so it was nice to be able to walk to it all downtown.
reviews.title: Loved it!!!!

reviews.text: My bowtie wearing, southern gentleman of a husband ALWAYS stays at the Dunhill when he is in the Queen City on business. I, on the other hand, consider myself a little more trendy. We are definitely the Soulful version of my favorite childhood show Green Acres! Well, the Westin, my usual stop for lux was booked up, sold out! What agony! My charming hubby called the Dunhill and like magic, a room appeared...and the second sold out night all of a sudden became available for one of it's biggest fans!
reviews.title: Oh My!
Anniversary celebration
reviews.text: Upon my arrival, Mike greeted me with a warm smile and all the southern charm a trendy girl could ask for! I was late getting to Charlotte. No problem, the restaurant was open, with great, healthy organic fare that was an absolute delicious dine.

In the morning, complimentary breakfast with all the fresh brewed java I could drink and I was off to a busy day in Uptown. No worries, did not have to walk one block in my 5 inch shoes, another Michael drove me in the Dunhill car exactly where I needed to go.....gratis plus a generous tip of course for the delightful conversation and the safe trip.
reviews.title: A classic,classy act

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes, all it took was a two day stay, a generous walk in shower with a soft robe to slip into afterwards and all the pampering a trendy girl could ask for. Westin who?
reviews.title: Lovely, historic hotel downtown
Boutique hotel with nice staff
reviews.text: We live in Charlotte and wanted to spend a night downtown to celebrate a special anniversary. The Dunhill fit the bill perfectly. We checked in Saturday afternoon and found the room beautiful and comfortable. We were able to walk down Tryon Street to museums and a delicious dinner at Bernadine's then back to a show at Spirit Square before returning to the Dunhill. Included breakfast the next morning at the attached Harvest Moon was very good, too. Fun to feel like a tourist in your own hometown.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Dunhill for 2 nights, and if you like boutique hotels you will love the Dunhill. All the staff where amazing, very helpful and accommodating. The room we stayed in was in excellent condition; the a/c was quiet, and there is no charge for the wifi. The lobby and bar area is small but has a real friendly atmosphere. Our complementary breakfast at the Harvest Moon restaurant was very nice. As a real bonus, warm cookies and milk are delivered to you room late afternoon.
reviews.title: The Staff are Wonderful

reviews.text: If you have never stayed in Charlotte be prepared for 4 levels of State, County, City, and Occupancy tax on your room totaling 15.25%.
reviews.title: Comfy Beds!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stay here whenever I have to travel to CLT for work. It is right downtown within walking distance of everything. There is a wonderful restaurant right onsite (Harvest Moon) and a small bar. While some of the rooms have small bathrooms, all the rooms I have stayed in are large and roomy. The beds are out of this world comfy. I have the best sleep here. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. The only thing I find myself wanting here is more electrical outlets, but this is an old historic building.
reviews.title: The Perfect Stay in Charlotte's Uptown!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you're planning a visit to Charlotte's uptown area, The Dunhill Hotel has it all--location, ambiance, charm--and all the creature comforts one needs for a perfectly delightful stay. From the wonderful staff to the spacious rooms and bathrooms (complete with amenities such as a well-stocked wet bar, plush robes and coffee maker), you won't be disappointed. (In fact, we fell in love with the bedding--it was truly the best night's sleep we've ever had at a hotel!). In addition to its charming southern décor and feel, the hotel also offers an intimate lobby bar and restaurant. With shopping, dining and the arena just a stroll away, The Dunhill Hotel proves a perfect stay for any Charlotte weekday/weekend getaway! Can't wait to return!
reviews.title: Comfortable and Central

reviews.text: We got a special rate through Sniqueaway (now Jetsetter) so decided to stay in a hotel that has been completely renovated but still preserves some of the original historic favor of its late 1920's origin. The room turned out to be a small suite, with a four poster bed at one end, a room-wide wardrobe across the other end, and love seat and large desk sandwiched in between. We were on the 9th floor, just below the penthouse floor, over looking Discovery Place next door. Room was fairly quiet except for an occasional emergency vehicle tearing down Tryon St. Free sodas and waters in the fridge, cookies and fresh milk provided later in the afternoon, and a capsule coffee maker in the room (although canisters of coffee always seemed to be available in the lobby). Much to our surprise, the stay included a free breakfast in the Harvest Moon Cafe next door, which specializes in serving fresh local foods from a 100 mile radius. My wife and I both had the scrambled eggs, sausage, toast, grits, and coffee -- very generous portions, too much to finish, but all very good. Location is just north of the Square and easy walking distance to several good restaurants and other activities. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: historic, welcoming hotel in Uptown Charlotte

reviews.text: Stayed in room 1001 for three nights. Queen bed with small sitting area and workspace. Good light in the room, top floor of hotel, end room. Good bedding. Tho on top floor, I heard lots of street noise and sirens. The hotel itself was quiet.
reviews.title: Wonderful staff, nice hotel, rooms could use a little refreshing
Amazing Stay
reviews.text: I arrived around noon and was greeted warmly, upgraded and able to check in early. Everyone who works at the hotel is lovely and helpful. I did not encounter one person who was rude or apathetic. The complimentary breakfast was very good for a free breakfast. Free bottled water and Diet Coke in room + coffee maker + small fridge.

Uptown is a nice area. I was surprised that while there's plenty of retail space, there's no shopping to speak of. It's all banks and restaurants. I was asked for money on the street every day, all day. The area feels fairly safe.
reviews.title: Location, location, location

reviews.text: The rooms could use some freshening - the carpets have seen better days. Better lighting in the bathroom would be nice. Better towels, too.
reviews.title: Charming downtown hotel in a great location - and the BEST biscuits ever!
